criteria: Understanding Unit Cubes as Measurement Tools
descriptions: Student does not demonstrate an understanding that volume is an attribute of solid figures.
Student shows limited understanding that volume is an attribute of solid figures; struggles to differentiate volume from area or perimeter.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding that volume is an attribute of solid figures but needs prompting to explain further.
Student demonstrates a clear understanding that volume is an attribute of solid figures and can explain it with some accuracy.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding that volume is an attribute of solid figures and accurately explains and provides examples.
Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding that volume is an attribute of solid figures, explains it clearly, provides insightful examples, and connects it to real-world applications.
Student does not understand the concept of a unit cube as a tool for measuring volume.
Student shows limited understanding of unit cubes and their role in measuring volume; struggles to visualize how unit cubes fill a solid figure.
Student demonstrates a basic understanding of unit cubes but needs guidance to use them in volume measurement.
Student demonstrates a clear understanding of unit cubes and can use them to measure the volume of simple solid figures.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of unit cubes and accurately measures the volume of various solid figures.

Student demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of unit cubes, accurately measures the volume of complex solid figures, and explains the relationship between unit cube size and measurement accuracy.
Student does not demonstrate ability to calculate volume, even of basic rectangular prisms.
Student attempts to calculate volume but makes significant errors in counting or applying formulas.
Student can calculate the volume of simple rectangular prisms with some errors or after guidance.
Student can accurately calculate the volume of rectangular prisms.
Student can accurately calculate the volume of rectangular prisms and figures composed of rectangular prisms.
Student can accurately calculate the volume of complex figures and explain why the methods used obtain the correct answer.
